children.name: consignment
children.definition: a quantity of goods that are sent somewhere, especially in order to be sold : hàng ký gửi (để bán)
examples: consignment of
a large consignment of clothes

children.name: commodity
children.definition: formala type of product or raw material that can be bought and sold – used especially about basic food products, metals, and fuels :
examples: The decline in prices for agricultural commodities made the economic situation worse.
All metal was a valuable commodity and was rarely wasted.

children.name: an important commodity
examples: Crude oil is the world’s most important commodity.

children.name: an expensive commodity
examples: Consumers began to find that they could afford more expensive commodities.

children.name: a valuable/precious commodity
examples: Land is an extremely valuable commodity.

children.name: a rare/scarce commodity
examples: Soap was a scarce commodity during the war.

children.name: a hot commodity
children.definition: one that a lot of people want to buy
examples: Web domains ending in .com became hot commodities.

children.name: a saleable/tradeable commodity
children.definition: one that can be sold or traded
examples: Land is a freely saleable commodity.

children.name: agricultural commodities
examples: The falling prices of agricultural commodities such as coffee have severely affected the economy.

children.name: industrial commodities
examples: Sales of the old industrial commodities of iron and coal are still important.

children.name: commodity prices
examples: Commodity prices are very high in the UK.

children.name: a commodity market
examples: Coffee is facing the deepest crisis in a global commodity market since the great depression of the 30s.

children.name: special
children.definition: a lower price than usual for a particular product for a short period of time::

children.name: a lunch special for $4.99
examples: Today's specials include T-shirts for only $2.99.

children.name: be on special
examples: Breyer’s ice cream is on special this week.

children.name: goods
children.definition: things that are produced in order to be sold, especially for use in the home : hàng hóa
examples: There will be tax increases on a range ofgoods and services.

children.name: electrical goods
examples: Today's shoppers are spending more money on mobile phones and electrical goods than on clothing.

children.name: household goods
examples: Household goods are downstairs in the basement.

children.name: consumer goods
children.definition: televisions, washing machines etc
examples: The market for consumer goods is huge.

children.name: manufactured goods
children.definition: made in large quantities using machines
examples: Imports of manufactured goods have increased rapidly.

children.name: industrial goods
children.definition: goods used mainly in the production of other goods
examples: machinery and other industrial goods

children.name: agricultural goods
examples: The United States became a major exporter of agricultural goods.

children.name: luxury goods
examples: The new industrial middle classes began to demand luxury goods.

children.name: duty-free goods
children.definition: that you do not pay tax on when you bring them into a country
examples: What is the permitted amount of duty-free goods?

children.name: white goodsBritish English
children.definition: equipment used in the home such as washing machines and refrigerators
examples: The house is unfurnished, except for white goods.

children.name: brown goodsBritish English
children.definition: electrical goods that provide entertainment at home such as televisions and stereo systems
examples: The company has 22 percent of the total market for brown goods.

children.name: perishable goods
children.definition: fresh food etc that is likely to decay quickly
examples: Perishable goods are transported in refrigerated trucks.

children.name: faulty goods
children.definition: that have something wrong with them
examples: Consumers have a right to reasonable protection against the sale of faulty goods.

children.name: stolen goods
examples: The police charged him with handling stolen goods.

children.name: counterfeit goods
children.definition: goods that are made to look like the real thing, but are not the real thing
examples: Counterfeit goods will be seized and traders will face prosecution.

children.name: sb’s worldly goods
children.definition: all the things that someone owns
examples: All his worldly goods fit in four packing cases.

children.name: goods and services
examples: The company provides a range of specialized goods and services.

children.name: produce goods
examples: The company started a factory in Singapore, to produce goods for export.

children.name: manufacture goods
examples: Local industries were created to manufacture goods that were previously imported.

children.name: import goods
examples: Western Europe is the world’s second largest market for imported goods.

children.name: export goods
examples: The company exports Thai goods to Europe.

children.name: supply goods
examples: On 3 September he supplied goods to the hotel valued at £350.00.

children.name: product
children.definition: sth that is made to be sold,usually something that is produced by an industrial process or, less commonly, something that is grown or obtained through farming
examples: agricultural/dairy/software etc products
consumer products such as VCRs
The London factory assemblesthe finished product.
He works in marketing and product development.
meat productsmeat products like sausages, pies and burgers

children.name: a commercial product
examples: They help firms turn good ideas into commercial products.

children.name: a consumer product
children.definition: one that is bought by the public
examples: Demand for consumer products has increased.

children.name: household products
examples: Do you know what chemicals are in household products such as washing powder and paint?

children.name: beauty/hair products
examples: She doesn’t buy beauty products that have been tested on animals.

children.name: dairy/milk products
examples: Some people are allergic to dairy products.

children.name: the finished product
examples: The quality of the finished product is all-important.

children.name: product development
examples: The money will be used to fund product development.

children.name: a product range/line
children.definition: the range of things that a company makes and sells
examples: We want to broaden the company’s product line.

children.name: exports
children.definition: export goods that are sent to a foreign country in order to be sold:hàng xuất khẩu
examples: Wheat is one of the country’s main exports.
British/US etc exportsHigher tariffs will affect a wide range of British exports.

children.name: the major/main/principal export
examples: Agricultural products are the country’s principal exports.

children.name: oil/agricultural/manufacturing exports
examples: Oil exports from Iraq have resumed.

children.name: invisible exports
children.definition: services that are exported, such as banking or insurance, rather than a product
examples: The City of London is important to the invisible exports of this country.

children.name: boost exports
children.definition: increase them
examples: The measures should boost exports and create employment.

children.name: encourage exports
children.definition: make them more likely to exist
examples: Kenya used subsidies to encourage exports.

children.name: reduce exports
examples: OPEC has threatened to reduce exports of oil to the West.

children.name: restrict exports
children.definition: limit or control them
examples: The government threatened to restrict exports because of weak demand.

children.name: ban exports
children.definition: stop them completely
examples: In retaliation, Britain banned exports of cloth to France.

children.name: exports increase/rise/grow
examples: Electronics exports grew more slowly than in previous years.

children.name: exports fall/decline/drop
examples: Exports of gas and oil continued to fall while imports of raw materials have risen.

children.name: exports account for something
children.definition: form a particular part of a total
examples: Exports currently account for 37% of sales.

children.name: a growth/rise/increase in exports
examples: The electronics sector has seen a 16% growth in exports.

children.name: a fall/decline/drop in exports
examples: There has been a decline in exports and an increase in oil prices.

children.name: merchandise
children.definition: formalthings that are produced in order to be sold, especially when they are shown for sale in a shop - used especially in business contexts:
examples: A range of official Disney merchandise was on sale.
They inspected the merchandise carefully.
The merchandise is attractively displayed and the assistants are friendly and helpful.
The fire at the warehouse destroyed merchandise valued at over $2 million.

children.name: imports
children.definition: import a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there: hàng nhập khẩu
examples: a ban on beef imports
import from
cheap imports from Asia
American demand for Japanese imports(= goods from Japan )

children.name: foreign imports
examples: Foreign imports into Britain continued to grow in the 1970s.

children.name: cheap imports
examples: Farmers are complaining about cheap imports flooding the market.

children.name: Japanese/French etc imports
children.definition: goods from Japan, France etc
examples: Japanese imports rose by 5% last year.

children.name: oil/coal/food imports
examples: The country is dependent on oil imports for almost all its basic energy needs.

children.name: rice/sugar etc imports
examples: There is pressure on the country to reduce its rice imports.

children.name: agricultural imports
examples: Restrictions on agricultural imports remain in place.

children.name: essential imports
examples: The country had problems paying for its essential imports.

children.name: luxury imports
examples: Higher duties were placed on luxury imports.

children.name: increase imports
examples: The company increased imports in order to cut domestic production costs.

children.name: reduce/cut imports
examples: New investment will reduce imports and save jobs.

children.name: control/restrict imports
children.definition: reduce or put a limit on them
examples: The scheme aims to control imports of cheap goods.

children.name: ban imports
children.definition: make them illegal
examples: The organization wants the government to ban imports of exotic birds.

children.name: imports increase/rise/grow
examples: Imports increased by 13 percent last year.

children.name: imports fall/drop
examples: Imports of consumer goods fell sharply in December.

children.name: wares
children.definition: writtenthings that are offered for sale, especially in a market or on the street : hàng rong, hàng vặt
examples: In the market, the traders began selling their wares.
Merchants brought their wares from all over the world.

children.name: brand
children.definition: a type of product made by a particular company, that has a particular name or design : nhãn hiệu

children.name: a top brand
examples: Kids want to have Nike and Reebok and other top brands.

children.name: a popular brand
examples: It’s the most popular brand of tequila in Mexico.

children.name: an own brandBritish English,a store brandAmerican English
children.definition: sold by a particular store under its own name
examples: A supermarket’s own brand should cost less than the nationally advertised brands.

children.name: the brand leader
children.definition: the brand that sells the most

children.name: a brand name
examples: The use of tobacco brand names in sponsoring sports has been banned.

children.name: a brand image
children.definition: the way a product or organization seems to the public
examples: A company carefully protects its brand image.

children.name: brand loyalty
children.definition: the tendency to always buy a particular brand
examples: Advertising is used to sell a product and create brand loyalty.

children.name: brand of
examples: What brand of detergent do you use?

children.name: a leading branda leading brand such as Toshiba
examples: Schwartz is the brand leader for herbs and spices in the UK.

children.name: brand
children.definition: /brænd/  a type of product made by a particular company - use this about products that you use every day such as food or drink or cleaning materials: hãng
examples: ▪ They sell all the usual kinds of coffee, but also some less well-known brands.

children.name: brand of
examples: ▪ Coke and Pepsi are the most popular brands of cola.

children.name: make
children.definition: /meɪk/  a type of product made by a particular company - use this about things such asmachines,equipment, andcars, not about food or drink:
examples: hãng
▪ What make is your washing machine?
make of
▪ ‘What make of car was she driving?’ ‘A Mercedes.’

children.name: model
children.definition: /ˈmɒdlǁˈmɑːdl/  one particular type ofcarormachinefrom among the various types that a company produces:
examples: mẫu
▪ ‘What make is the car?’ ‘It’s a Ford.’ ‘And what model?’ ‘An Escort 1.8L.’
▪ We produce a range of different computers, but this is our most popular model.

children.name: proprietary
children.definition: formala proprietary product is one that is sold under a trade name: có đăng ký độc quyền sản xuất
examples: aproprietary brandof insecticide
proprietary software products
proprietary medicines

children.name: generic
children.definition: a generic product does not have a special name to show that it is made by a particular company : không có nguồn gốc xuất xứ
examples: generic drugs

children.name: output
children.definition: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc: sản lượng
examples: Output is up 30% on last year.
In manufacturing alone, smaller firms account for one in three jobs and a quarter of the total output.
manufacturing/industrial/agricultural etc output
Korea’s agricultural output
Last year British manufacturing output fell by 14%.
output of
the world’s output of carbon dioxide
There has been a huge increase in the output of children’s books.

children.name: production
children.definition: the amount of goods that are made or grown - use this especially about the number of things produced in a factory or in a particular industry: sản lượng
examples: As demand for the drug has grown, cocaine production has skyrocketed.
Bulmers will be making around 40 million gallons of cider this year -- half Britain’s total production.
production of
Most caustic soda is used in the production of aluminium.
increase/rise/fall etc in production
a drop in oil and gas production
Swedish industrial production has fallen steadily this year.
Wheat production has risen over the years.
production levels/targets etc

children.name: end product
children.definition: sth that is produced by a particular process or activity : sản phẩm cuối
examples: a high-quality end product
the end product of years of practiceby-product[C] sth additional that is produced during a natural or industrial process : sản phẩm phụ
by-product of
a by-product of oil refining
Buttermilk is a by-productofmaking butter.

children.name: by-product
children.definition: sth additional that is produced during a natural or industrial process : sản phẩm phụ
examples: by-product of
a by-product of oil refining
Buttermilk is a by-productofmaking butter.

children.name: bestseller
children.definition: a popular product, that many people buy :
examples: The game is already a bestseller in Japan.

children.name: range
children.definition: / lineUS C1 a set of similar products made by a particular company or available in a particular shop : mặt hàng
examples: There are discounts on many items from our older lines.
I was shown all their new lines.
The watches in this range are priced at £24.50.
range of
a new range of kitchenware
A company from Darlington has just launched its latest range of fashion jewellery.
We stock thefullrangeofmodel railway accessories.

children.name: a full/complete range
examples: The store stocks a full range of groceries.

children.name: an extensive range
examples: The winner will receive a brand-new kitchen from Magnet’s extensive range.

children.name: a comprehensive range
examples: We offer a comprehensive range of services for the business traveller.

children.name: a new/latest range
examples: Body Blitz is a new range of toiletries specially designed for teenagers.

children.name: a product range
examples: We need to broaden our product range.

children.name: a colour range
examples: British English,a color rangeAmE: These curtains are available in a much wider colour range.

children.name: stock
children.definition: nounSUPPLY hàngcó sẵn trongkho

children.name: shopping
children.definition: goods which you have bought from shops, especially food : hàng vừa mua
examples: She had so manybags ofshopping that she could hardly carry them.
Can you help me carry the shopping, please?

children.name: a shopping list
children.definition: a list of what you need to buy, especially of food
examples: Always take a shopping list so you are not tempted to buy things you do not need.

children.name: second
children.definition: nounDAMAGED PRODUCT
examples: hàng thứ phẩm,hàng chế tạo có khuyết tật và do đó bán rẻ hơn;

children.name: bar code
children.definition: nounmã vạch

children.name: a small rectangular pattern of thick and thin black lines of magnetic ink printed on a product, or on its container, etc. so that its details can be read by and recorded on a computer system
examples: _A hand-held scanner is used to read bar codes.

children.name: work
children.definition: nounACTIVITY
